head.title: Pakistan Questions 2 in Daniel Pearl Killing

hedline.hl1: Pakistan Questions 2 in Daniel Pearl Killing

abstract.p: Pakistani officials say two people arrested in Sindh Province are being investigated for any links to killing of American journalist Daniel Pearl in 2002; claim two are involved with banned Sunni Muslim militant group Lashkar-e-Jhangvi; Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, top Al Qaeda commander captured in 2003, claimed he decapitated Pearl (S)

block.p: Pakistani officials said they were investigating two people arrested Monday in Kashmor, a remote town in the southern province of Sindh, for any links to the killing of the American journalist Daniel Pearl in 2002.
Noor Ahmed Paichuho, the Kashmor police chief, said in a telephone interview that the men, Attaur Rehman and Faisal Bhatti, were being interrogated in Kashmor.

Pakistani officials said they were investigating two people arrested Monday in Kashmor, a remote town in the southern province of Sindh, for any links to the killing of the American journalist Daniel Pearl in 2002.
Noor Ahmed Paichuho, the Kashmor police chief, said in a telephone interview that the men, Attaur Rehman and Faisal Bhatti, were being interrogated in Kashmor.

Javed Iqbal Cheema, a retired brigadier who is the director of the national crisis management office here in the capital, said the men were involved with Lashkar-e-Jhangvi, a banned Sunni Muslim militant group. ''We are investigating if they are the same persons involved in Pearl murder or not,'' Brigadier Cheema said. ''Let's wait and see.''

Mr. Pearl, a Wall Street Journal reporter, was kidnapped in Karachi while looking into ties between Al Qaeda and the shoe bomber Richard C. Reid, who was convicted of trying to blow up a trans-Atlantic flight in December 2001.
Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, a top commander for Al Qaeda who was captured in Pakistan in 2003, claimed to have decapitated Mr. Pearl.
